Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
CAN: The student can draw a simple version of a land habitat, like a playground, and a basic water habitat, such as a pond, with some elements, but might lack details.
The student can illustrate some plants in each habitat, possibly with basic shapes for trees and bushes, but may not label them all.
The student can include a few animals in each habitat, like a squirrel or fish, but may only label some or none.
CANNOT: The student does not clearly compare the variety of living things between the two habitats. *(student doesnâ€™t make the comparison explicitly)*
The student cannot accurately illustrate and label a wide range of plants and animals, often omitting or mislabeling them. *(limited understanding or attempt to label varied life forms)*
The student fails to show clear patterns of diversity across habitats. *(no explicit recognition or labeling of diversity patterns)*
The student might not fully represent how observations from media or firsthand experiences informed their drawings. *(limited connection to observations)*
